t: Matthew 20
Laborers in the Vineyard
“For*rp the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r like*r a*r master*r of*r a*r house*r who*r went*r out*r early*r in*r the*r morning*r to*r hire*r laborers*r for*r his*r vineyard.*r
After*r agreeing*r with*r the*r laborers*r for*r a*r denarius*r a*r day,*r he*r sent*r them*r into*r his*r vineyard.*r
And*r going*r out*r about*r the*r third*r hour*r he*r saw*r others*r standing*r idle*r in*r the*r marketplace,*r
and*r to*r them*r he*r said,*r ‘You*r go*r into*r the*r vineyard*r too,*r and*r whatever*r is*r right*r I*r will*r give*r you.’*r
So*r they*r went.*r Going*r out*r again*r about*r the*r sixth*r hour*r and*r the*r ninth*r hour,*r he*r did*r the*r same.*r
And*r about*r the*r eleventh*r hour*r he*r went*r out*r and*r found*r others*r standing.*r And*r he*r said*r to*r them,*r ‘Why*r do*r you*r stand*r here*r idle*r all*r day?’*r
They*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Because*r no*r one*r has*r hired*r us.’*r He*r said*r to*r them,*r ‘You*r go*r into*r the*r vineyard*r too.’*r

And*r when*r evening*r came,*r the*r owner*r of*r the*r vineyard*r said*r to*r his*r foreman,*r ‘Call*r the*r laborers*r and*r pay*r them*r their*r wages,*r beginning*r with*r the*r last,*r up*r to*r the*r first.’*r
And*r when*r those*r hired*r about*r the*r eleventh*r hour*r came,*r each*r of*r them*r received*r a*r denarius.*r
Now*r when*r those*r hired*r first*r came,*r they*r thought*r they*r would*r receive*r more,*r but*r each*r of*r them*r also*r received*r a*r denarius.*r
And*r on*r receiving*r it*r they*r grumbled*r at*r the*r master*r of*r the*r house,*r
saying,*r ‘These*r last*r worked*r only*r one*r hour,*r and*r you*r have*r made*r them*r equal*r to*r us*r who*r have*r borne*r the*r burden*r of*r the*r day*r and*r the*r scorching*r heat.’*r
But*r he*r replied*r to*r one*r of*r them,*r ‘Friend,*r I*r am*r doing*r you*r no*r wrong.*r Did*r you*r not*r agree*r with*r me*r for*r a*r denarius?*r
Take*r what*r belongs*r to*r you*r and*r go.*r I*r choose*r to*r give*r to*r this*r last*r worker*r as*r I*r give*r to*r you.*r
Am*r I*r not*r allowed*r to*r do*r what*r I*r choose*r with*r what*r belongs*r to*r me?*r Or*r do*r you*r begrudge*r my*r generosity?’*r
So*r the*r last*r will*r be*r first,*r and*r the*r first*r last.”*r
Jesus Foretells His Death a Third Time
And*p as Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples aside, and on the way he said to them,

“See,*r we*r are*r going*r up*r to*r Jerusalem.*r And*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r delivered*r over*r to*r the*r chief*r priests*r and*r scribes,*r and*r they*r will*r condemn*r him*r to*r death*r
and*r deliver*r him*r over*r to*r the*r Gentiles*r to*r be*r mocked*r and*r flogged*r and*r crucified,*r and*r he*r will*r be*r raised*r on*r the*r third*r day.”*r
A Mother’s Request
Then*p the mother of the sons of Zebedee came up to him with her sons, and kneeling before him she asked him for something.
And he said to her, “What*r do*r you*r want?”*r She said to him, “Say that these two sons of mine are to sit, one at your right hand and one at your left, in your kingdom.”
Jesus answered, “You*r do*r not*r know*r what*r you*r are*r asking.*r Are*r you*r able*r to*r drink*r the*r cup*r that*r I*r am*r to*r drink?”*r They said to him, “We are able.”

He said to them, “You*r will*r drink*r my*r cup,*r but*r to*r sit*r at*r my*r right*r hand*r and*r at*r my*r left*r is*r not*r mine*r to*r grant,*r but*r it*r is*r for*r those*r for*r whom*r it*r has*r been*r prepared*r by*r my*r Father.”*r
And when the ten heard it, they were indignant at the two brothers.
But Jesus called them to him and said, “You*r know*r that*r the*r rulers*r of*r the*r Gentiles*r lord*r it*r over*r them,*r and*r their*r great*r ones*r exercise*r authority*r over*r them.*r
It*r shall*r not*r be*r so*r among*r you.*r But*r whoever*r would*r be*r great*r among*r you*r must*r be*r your*r servant,*r
and*r whoever*r would*r be*r first*r among*r you*r must*r be*r your*r slave,*r
even*r as*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r came*r not*r to*r be*r served*r but*r to*r serve,*r and*r to*r give*r his*r life*r as*r a*r ransom*r for*r many.”*r
Jesus Heals Two Blind Men
And*p as they went out of Jericho, a great crowd followed him.
And behold, there were two blind men sitting by the roadside, and when they heard that Jesus was passing by, they cried out, “Lord, have mercy on us, Son of David!”
The crowd rebuked them, telling them to be silent, but they cried out all the more, “Lord, have mercy on us, Son of David!”
And stopping, Jesus called them and said, “What*r do*r you*r want*r me*r to*r do*r for*r you?”*r
They said to him, “Lord, let our eyes be opened.”
And Jesus in pity touched their eyes, and immediately they recovered their sight and followed him.
